thread.title: AHCA vote live blog: The latest on House health care law.
thread.title_full: AHCA vote live blog: The latest on House health care law.

title: AHCA vote live blog: The latest on House health care law.
text:
March 23 2017 2:36 PM AHCA Vote Delayed, Possibly Until Next Week This is a dramatic photo of the Capitol, where dramatic events are currently ongoing. Mark Wilson/Getty Images 
House Speaker Paul Ryan has said he will hold a vote Thursday on the American Health Care Act, the Republican Party's Obamacare replacement plan. But whether the bill will pass is still an open question. Below: Running updates on the vote counting, negotiation, and desperate spinning currently going down in D.C. 
The current takeaway: Republicans have 237 seats in the house and need 215 votes to pass this bill, which means they can only afford 22 Republican "no" votes . The most recent running tallies list between 26 and 37 Republicans who have said they are "no" votes at this moment, meaning that if a vote were taken now the bill would not pass . Load Comments
